section.para: Function to be called directly from other modules to load the API. On success return 0, on error 1.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
This function supports calling Erlang functions on remote nodes. On success function returns 0.
Meaning of parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: ei_x_buff* reply - dynamic ei buffer where RPC reply returns.
ei_x_buff *args - dynamic ei buffer with encoded arguments.

section.para: This function sends an Erlang term to a registered process. On success return 0.
Meaning of parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: str *server - string containing registered name of the intended recipient process on remote node.
ei_x_buff *msg - dynamic ei buffer with encoded erlang term. The msg must be encoded with version byte.

section.para: This function sends an Erlang term to a process. On success return 0.
Meaning of parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: erlang_pid *pid - pid of the intended recipient process on remote node.
ei_x_buff *msg - dynamic ei buffer with encoded erlang term. The msg must be encoded with version byte.

section.para: Function to send reply on processed message.
Meaning of parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: ei_x_buff *msg - dynamic ei buffer with encoded erlang term.

section.para: Function encodes XAVP variable into ei dynamic buffer. How to create XAVP variable see source code.
Meaning of parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: ei_x_buff *xbuff - dynamic ei buffer where XAVP variable will be encoded.
sr_xavp_t *xavp - XAVP variable to be encoded.

section.para: Function decodes ei dynamic buffer into XAVP variable.
Meaning of parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: sr_xavp_t **xavp - XAVP variable where ei buffer will be decoded.
